page.title: 04The Glassworks
page.content: They export to N & S America, N. Zealand and Australia. The sand used for making glass comes from Scotland and Belgium. Production only stops at Christmas and New Year; but furnaces must remain hot. Annual fuel costs: gas, Â£500,000, electricity just under Â£250,000. It is cheaper to use gas than oil. The glasswork's cone is a listed building no longer in use. It is constructed of about 2,000,000 bricks. Newcastle City Council hope to renovate it and lease it to small industries for studio glass. Mr. Goodwin, the manager, says that although plastic is used more and more for glass containers there will always be a place for glass. Also in the area are a number of factory units on two small new industrial estates.
